Class ViewTerminal

java.lang.Object
graphics.ViewTerminal
public final class ViewTerminal extends Object
ViewTerminal contains every function used to interact with the player and print the state of the geme in the terminal version of Cascadia

  • Method Details

    • printHead

      public static int printHead(Map<Coordinate,TileSquare> player, AnimalCard card, DrawSquare draw, int currentPlayer)
      printHead prints everything the player needs to choose from the draw, including the player board
      Parameters:
      player - Map representing the player's board
      card - AnimalCard representing the current card used
      draw - DrawSquare representing the draw
      currentPlayer - int representing the player currently playing its turn
      Returns:
      an int representing the player input

    • askOverpopulation

      public static boolean askOverpopulation(DrawSquare draw)
      askOverpopulation prints the current state of the draw (over populated) and ask for player input
      Parameters:
      draw - DrawSquare representing the draw
      Returns:
      a boolean representing the player input, true means yes, false means no

    • choiceMoveTileOrWildelife

      public static int choiceMoveTileOrWildelife(Set<Coordinate> moves, boolean tileOrNot)
      choiceMoveTileOrWildelife prints the available tile or wildlife moves
      Parameters:
      moves - Set representing all the moves available
      tileOrNot - boolean representing if it's a tile or a wildlife token move
      Returns:
      int representing the player input

    • printWinner

      public static void printWinner(CountPointSquare point, int winner)
      printWinner prints the winner of the game
      Parameters:
      point - CountPointSquare containing the points of each players
      winner - int representing the winning player

    • choiceAnimalCard

      public static AnimalCard choiceAnimalCard()
      choiceAnimalCard prints the choice for the 2 animal cards available in the terminal version
      Returns:
      AnimalCard the chosen card

    • choiceTileBegin

      public static int choiceTileBegin(int[] forbidenNumber, int player)
      choiceTileBegin prints the necessary knowledge to pick a beginning tile, which is not much since the choice is made blindly
      Parameters:
      forbidenNumber - the tiles already taken by an other player
      player - int representing the player currently making his choice
      Returns:
      int representing the chosen beginning tile
